QAPair.Question: What is (are) Endophthalmitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Endophthalmitis involves swelling (inflammation) within the eyeball. It is a serious condition.

QAPair.Question: What causes Endophthalmitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Endophthalmitis is caused by infection with bacteria or a fungus. It very often occurs as a rare complication of cataract or other eye surgery or an injury to the eye.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Endophthalmitis ?
QAPair.Answer:
The symptoms are:
Decreased vision
, Pain , Redness, Swelling of the eyelids , Call your health care provider right away if you have these symptoms after eye surgery.
